abstract: Microsoft said on Tuesday that it would buy Powerset Inc., an Internet search company, the latest in a string of acquisitions aimed at bolstering its position online.
snippet: Microsoft said on Tuesday that it would buy Powerset Inc., an Internet search company, the latest in a string of acquisitions aimed at bolstering its position online.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO (Dow Jones)  Microsoft said on Tuesday that it would buy Powerset Inc., an Internet search company, the latest in a string of acquisitions aimed at bolstering its position online.

abstract: As rumored last week, Microsoft said on Tuesday that it would buy Powerset The Internet search company acquisitions is the latest in a string of purchases aimed at bolstering Microsoft’s position online.
lead_paragraph: As rumored last week, Microsoft said on Tuesday that it would buy Powerset The Internet search company acquisitions is the latest in a string of purchases aimed at bolstering Microsoft’s position online.

abstract: Microsoft is preparing a new bid for Yahoo‘s search business and has approached other media companies about joining it in a deal that would effectively lead to Yahoo’s breakup, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft is preparing a new bid for Yahoo‘s search business and has approached other media companies about joining it in a deal that would effectively lead to Yahoo’s breakup, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

headline.main: Microsoft Said to Still Pursue Yahoo Deal

abstract: IRiver, a maker of mobile media players, is trying to make a comeback with some innovative new devices, but it’s unclear whether the company can gain traction against big players like Apple, Microsoft, Nokia and Google.
snippet: IRiver, a maker of mobile media players, is trying to make a comeback with some innovative new devices, but it’s unclear whether the company can gain traction against big players like Apple, Microsoft, Nokia and Google.
lead_paragraph: Once upon a time if you wanted music on the go, you pretty much paid up for a Sony Walkman or grabbed a no-name piece of plastic from a bin at Walgreens.
